title: NASA warns of near-term cost growth on Mars Sample Return
summary: COLORADO SPRINGS — NASA’s effort to return samples from Mars could require $250 million more than currently planned over the next two years, putting more pressure on the agency’s overall […]

title: Space Forge reveals plans for U.S. manufacturing
summary: Space Forge announced plans April 19 to expand its U.S. presence to include manufacturing.

title: Space Force in wait-and-see mode as ULA continues to investigate upper-stage anomaly
summary: The head of the U.S. Space Force launch program, Maj. Gen. Stephen Purdy, said he has been briefed by United Launch Alliance on an anomaly experienced last month during testing of the Centaur upper stage of ULA’s new rocket Vulcan Centaur.

title: NRO seeks innovative electro-optics
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is casting a wide net in its latest bid for commercial Earth observation.

title: SpaceX to Launch Upgraded Starlink Satellites After Issues with First Batch
summary: SpaceX is preparing to launch its second batch of upgraded Starlink satellites after some of the first version 2 (v2) buses deorbited earlier than planned. Liftoff aboard a Falcon 9 rocket is scheduled for April 19 at 8:27 AM EDT (12:27 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.
